parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
The night, night-time. A primary word; 'night'.
(a) of time: still, yet, even now, (b) of degree: even, further, more, in addition. Perhaps akin to etos; 'yet, ' still.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
From the base of chraomai or chre; employment, i.e. An affair; also occasion, demand, requirement or destitution.
Light, a source of light, radiance. From an obsolete phao; luminousness.
A lamp. From the base of leukos; a portable lamp or other illuminator.
And, even, also, namely.
The sun, sunlight. From hele; the sun; by implication, light.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From phos; to shed rays, i.e. To shine or to brighten up.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I rule, reign, (b) I reign over. From basileus; to rule.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
